name: Air Fryer Oven Pork Jerky
author: Soup Loving Nicole
summary: I typically leave the jerky making to my husband but I got an air fryer oven and decided to try my hand at it. While it does take time, it doesn't take near as long as the dehydrator method he uses. This was so easy, full of flavor, stores well, and just overall impressive! This is the perfect snack for camping, hiking, fishing, hunting, or any outdoor activity.
directions: Combine ground pork, sesame oil, Sriracha, soy sauce, rice vinegar, salt, black pepper, onion powder, and pink curing salt in a large bowl; mix until evenly combined
Using a jerky gun, form as many sticks as you can fit on all three of the air fryer oven racks
They will shrink almost immediately so you can put them close together and utilize the full length of the racks
I was able to get 21 sticks the first go around
Set the air fryer oven to 160 degrees Fahrenheit
Place all three racks in and cook for 1 hour
Remove racks from the oven and blot excess moisture with paper towels
Flip each stick and cook for 1 more hour
Repeat step 4 for a total cook time of 3 hours
Transfer jerky sticks to a paper towel-lined baking sheet
Cover with another layer of paper towels and let sit out 8 hours for final drying
Repeat with any remaining jerky mix
Transfer jerky to an airtight container and refrigerate for up to 30 days
